subject: Sleep
title: Can We Record Dreams
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Can We Record Dreams.

hook.text: Scientists decoded brain activity to reconstruct images a person was seeing. Could this work for dreams?

buildup.text: In 2013, Japanese researchers used fMRI to predict dream content from brain patterns with some accuracy.

discovery.text: They matched dream-stage brain activity to a database of waking visual patterns and identified objects.

twist.text: The results were crude, identifying categories like person, building, or text, not detailed images.

climax.text: Full dream recording is still science fiction. But decoding basic dream content is now science fact.

punchline.text: We can't film dreams yet, but we can peek.

quiz.question: What did Japanese researchers achieve with dream decoding?
options: Predicting broad dream content categories from brain scans
